reviews.review_msg: Great prof.  Interesting lectures.
Great prof.  Knows his stuff.  Willing to go the extra mile to help students.
FUNNY guy felt asleep alot tho bcuz he only talks and no notes (or i missed them while i was sleeping)  pretty good prof
Good prof. Knows his stuff, but tends to go off topic.
One of the most interesting profs!!! He always plays the devil's advocate

just don't do it. She was extremely petty and passive towards students, she says she wants students to asks questions but when they do, she seems to get mad at them for them genuinely being confused. Course material was easy but she made it more difficult than it had to be.
Avoid her. I do not normally make reviews on professors, but I just needed to ensure the safety of future students.
A W F U L Terrible class. It was boring, dry and the material was out of date. Sherri is also very rude and condescending in her responses to students.
I would just run. I do not recommend her at all. She is super anal about anything and everything. She's very passive-aggressive when replying to students as well.

I took her course online and there were a lot of videos and readings to do each week (which is natural for an online course). The exams appear difficult due to the wording of the questions, but they are graded fairly (you'll probably do better on them than you think). She is really caring and kind. If you put in the effort you can do well!

My TA was Jennifer. Make to sure to pay attention to the modules and the textbook since there are no lecture notes provided. Youll have to make your own notes. Her exams were kinda confusing, but definitely doable. There was also a presentation, essay, and weekly online quizzes which were pretty easy and marked reasonably.
Take it with anyone else than Fabian.

Really passionate teacher, who is very knowledgeable about the course subject. Lectures could be very dry and outdated for online students. Lots of reading - and its super repatative (but hey, at least it prepares you for exams).
Maybe it was because the topics covered in the class were dry, or maybe it was because of the prof, but I would not recommend this class. If you have to take it, take it with another lecturer.

Had Sheri for 131 and was the worst mistake. I heard she was a pretty decent prof so I rolled the dice on her. Turns out I got snake eyes. She unfortunately made moderate material dry and boring. She was inaccessible and Kurt to students with fair questions in lecture. All around a dry prof! Take 131 with Sharmaine Perkins instead if you can.

Most people didn't like her but I thought she was alright. In the first semester, she was great, readings were only 10ish pages midterm was fair and she was very reasonable when I got confused with an assignment. Second term: readings were 25 pages and the final was quite hard ( especially since I hadn't done the readings for the 2nd term.
worst prof
This class is boring. Im sure it would be better if there were another prof teaching it.

Sheri is my favorite prof! She is very clear in lectures about what will be on the tests, so if you listen to that and use those to study you will do very well in the course. She is also very willing to help students and answers emails very quickly.  I would love to take another class with Sheri! She made lectures so fun and interesting.
Very clear about what she expects and prepares you well for her finals. Cares about her students and gives great lectures.
Great Prof. I personally did not use the textbook and still finished with an A-. Pay attention during the lectures, she will hint as to what is on the exam.

I loved her way of teaching and enthusiasm for the materials; however she and her TA's are not helpful at all and make going to office hours rather difficult and intimidating especially if you're a bit shy like me. Course load is HEAVY. there are 2-3 articles every week to read and do a quiz on and you also have to do read 2-3 chapters for class.

Professor Fabian is very organized and is a good professor for students that are passionate about Crim! She released the breakdown of each section of the midterm and there was an opportunity to review the exam. Super helpful and passionate prof! Would recommend to Crim students.
She is an amazing professor if you put in the work. Her exams are heavily based on what she makes you star in lectures, textbook and on guest lectures.

Sheri is a knowledgeable individual that knows her stuff. She is an experienced lecturer and being a first-year student, I found her class to be very fair. Expect to put effort into the class. This class is neither easy or difficult, just plain fair. If you are an A student with a decent interest in the CJS, you will do perfectly fine.

Great class with a great prof. Attendance is mandatory. Sheri often tells you to put stars beside certain lecture slides (which means they are going to show up as written questions on the exam FOR SURE). Would take another class with her

One of my favorite CRIM profs! This isn't an "easy" class or a "GPA booster" but it is more than fair if your willing to put in the work. I preferred the E-Tutorials over regular in-class tutorials (minus the fact that they are more time consuming)
Great prof, she knows what shes doing and she is helpful indeed.
Love Sheri! Best prof ever!

Haven't been impressed with many of the CRIM profs in my first year here but Sheri was exceptional. Very fair, helpful and clear in her expectations. Doesn't expect too much from first year students but is still able to push us. Definitely plan on taking more courses with her

I was really surprised that Sheri had such a low easiness rating. Sheri is one of the fairest profs I have ever had. Her exams are reasonable and paper was straightforward. If you study and put the time in to the learn the material you should have no problem in this class

Best prof I've had during my first yr uni. Her exams are fair, mostly based on memorization. The online quizzes and assignment took up a bit of time. Her notes are pretty clear and when she tells you to star something (meaning it will be on an exam), she means it. She's  a very interesting prof and always tells us some of her personal stories.
If she says its going to be on the exam, she means it. However, this class was the most difficult class for my semester. She is not very clear about anything. There are tons of content to go over.

so boring, tests arent easy. lots of memorizing, alot of notes. online tutorials are way to time consuming. Overall this class is way to time consuming for it to be a "100" level. I would not recommend this professor.
When she says in lecture that a certain topic will be on a final, she means it. Really great professor who loves what she's doing, even entertaining at times. I would recommend her for sure!
tip: when Sherri gives a hint in class that something is going to be on the test, she means it.

She is good with lectures but with assignments, she lacks clarity. Only thing she did with assigning the paper is to throw the PDF format of instructions rather than going over the instructions verbally in class. Exam was fair but the assignments are marked hard. She is not really approachable and the TA is not also approachable, even with email.

personal anecdotes are kinda funny to listen to, he has a sense of humor which is nice. the clarity wasnt always the best, and it was kind of boring at times.. but hey, you can't win em all.  a nice guy overall, not the best notes either.. but hey.
Terrible prof, he doesn't know jack about teaching, and he is certainly doesn't have a clue on how to teach a subjective field like Criminology. Memorize word-for-word or fail.
just study his notes for the exams cuz they are straight from the text. it's more about memorization than anything. great stories told during lectures cuz he's a cop.

Lecture and texts are wastes of time and money. He just pulls blocks directly from the text for lecture slides and uses exactly that for the exams, so get notes off a friend and save money and time on a text you really need. Refuses to tape lectures
Good Prof with a good teaching style.  He needs to learn how to right an exam that doesnt have vague open ended questions.

Really interesting prof because he has a personal story to back up everything we learn! Also very approachable, but the exams are kind of random, and more about memorization rather than understanding.

i took 131 and another intro with him and i loved it. very funny and easy class. exams mostly based on lectures but still read the book (esp. for his 104). overall i would love to take more classes with him!

Took his crim 101 and 131, funny prof, materials are not that interesting but easy exams, all based on notes. some of the questions are from tutorial presentations, unless you are going to read every article, i recommend go to tutorials.

Freakin' love this prof.  Hilarious and easy to understand PowerPoint slides.  Stuff that he says will be on the exams, will appear EXACTLY THE SAME (word-for-word from his notes) on the exams.  Easy grade or GPA booster.
THE BEST CLASS I'VE HAD AT SFU! WILL DEFINITELY RETAKE WITH THIS PROF!!!!!!! TA KELLY BOHL IS AWESOME TOO!!! =) A+++

This class is a joke. Actually all lower level crim courses with him are but they're great gpa boosters. He makes dry material interesting and kept me amused with a few jokes here and there so he's a good prof I suppose. I'd take another course with him. oh yea go to lecture, ESPECIALLY the review for the midterm and final

Barry is amazing. His tests are straight forward and simple. No matter how hard you try not to learn sth, you will leave his class having absorbed some information about criminology.. It was said that ppl will literally pay you to drop out of his class so they can take it themselves.. now I know why
No Comments

Awesome prof makes the lectures clear and easy to understand. Also makes it interesting so you dont fall asleep in class. Midterm and final was no surprises, go to lectures and pay attention for sure youll get a good grade. I would take his class again anytime.
Barry is a great prof.  His lecture notes are extremely helpful and the course itself is interesting.  One of the best class I have taken so far at SFU!
This class was great.  Really interesting and straightforward, lectures are not boring like other 2 hour classes. Just go to class and take the notes and that's all you'll need for the final!
No Comments

(i'm still in the middle of the semester) fantastic professor! very funny, loves what he's doing, hates youth offenders and is in favour of the electric chair (LOL)! just print out his overheads and fill them out in lecture and you'll pass the course. midterm exam was pretty easy, the essay topics are ok, TA (Raegan) rocks.

super nice proff, just show up to class and copy the notes and you'll dp fine. material is some what interesting. Overall, a great professor that jokes around, would take a course with him again for sure!

FUNNY prof. Some think he's lame, but hey, have a sense of humor why dontcha? I won't say the course is easy, (since he might see this and make it harder for the rest of you), it was overall FAIR. Don't slack though, as the midterm results showed, it is possible to get an F.
Take courses with this guy. He is a nice prof and sooooooo good to students. Not a curved courses, so everybody does well, all get A+. He is a friendly, and nice person. Take courses with him!

Well, he tries to be funny... to no avail. However, it does make his lectures differentiated from the average profs lectures. He may be short, but he is a good prof. Not just because his class(es) are easy, but because he does his best to field all questions asked. Also, he is very fair.
Excellent prof, excellent course, excellent material, what more could you ask for? Study his lecture notes for exams and you'll do just fine!
IF YOU WANT A GPA BOOSTER TAKE ALL HIS COURSES BECAUSE ITS AN EASY A. NOTES ARE WELL ORGANIZED AND GIVEN IN ADVANCED.
great prof, good marker, an entertainer. However, I wish the course was a little more challenging or that we discussed some real life examples. but a super great prof, and Im glad hes at SFU
Makes lectures entertaining with his jokes.  Exams are easy if you put the work in.  He makes the subject fun and enjoyable.
Semi-Interesting class that Barry tried hard to make enjoyable.  Detailed notes that go along way when studying for exams.  If you put the effort in, you can do very well in this course.
he's a really good prof. He makes the material interesting and throws in jokes to make it fun!
The best professor ever :) He is very clear and very helpful. Makes the course very interesting. I love his lectures ! If you study, you'll do really well.
I liked him a lot. His exams are REALLY easy.However, you really need to go to lectures.His jokes are funny. Sometimes his lectures can be boring though.
take this course if u want to upgrade ur gpa !!
great prof like everyone else said, fair midterms and final (easy too), everything on tests is from the notes, didn't even need to study out of the text. funny guy too.

extremely easy class, everything is very straightforward, no surprises.  He puts part of his lecture notes online so you don't have to copy everything down.  exams are extremely easy.  cracks lots of jokes...most of them lame

Great prof!  Organized, thorough lectures, easy to take notes for.  Predictable tests - he structures his courses for success, and his sample exams will give you a taste of the real thing.  Prompt email responses to questions.  Great sense of humour too! :)
He's a very nice guy. Always reply my emails within a day. Tries really hard to make the material interesting.
No Comments
Pretty easy professor.  Tries to make the material fun and he seems to care about the course itself a lot.  Lots of scripted jokes though.
great lecturer, easy exams and class
good lectures and easy exams
No Comments
no communication

I took CRIM 131 Distance Education and it was a great course. Griffiths provides his own textbook, a study guide, and a CD full of MP3 notes and interviews. Had to write 3 papers and write a final, all of which were fairly easy relative to other courses. Just stay ontop of the material and you will do great!

Rachelle is an amazing prof! She genuinely cares for students, and wants us to succeed. She makes the tutorials engaging and all her grading is super transparent. She encourages class participation but won't pick on you to speak which I appreciate. I took this course as an elective (I'm in BPK) and now I'm sad I wont have another class with her.

Rachelle is a great prof, very straightforward. Go to class, get the grade, no bs. Korrie Grant is an amazing TA, preps you for exams and will give you all the support you need. Exams all lecture material, nothing stressful. 1 court observation and group project honeslty as long as you follow the instructions you're good. 100% recommend.

Rachelle was an amazing prof and her lectures were very engaging. She showed a lot of videos and brought in a few guest speakers. The TA's are also very nice and helpful. Her exams are very straight forward, mostly from the lecture slides and from what the guest speakers said. She has a group project but it is very easy.

AN AMAZING PROF!!!!! I had Korrie Grant as my TA and she was also AMAZING!! this class had interesting concepts. there was a court observation assignment which was kind of fun. there was a partner project which involved some arts and crafts. the midterm was super str8 forward- straight from lecture slides.  ALSO had guest speakers. SO GOOD!!

Dr. Fredericks is the most amazing prof I've had so far, its clear that she cares a lot about her students. Her lectures are interesting, easy to follow, and she puts a lot of emphasis on the material most likely to be tested. She was also very understanding with deadlines and papers. Overall great experience, I'd take any course taught by her

Super kind and genuinely caring to the class. Flexible with due dates if you reach out which was also great. I found her lectures made me somewhat interested in criminology but they could be a little dry sometimes. Her grading was also really fair and honestly kinda lenient. If you're reading this Dr. Fredericks, thank you for the great class :)

Kaitlin was an absolute gem. She obviously cares so much for the wellbeing of her students, starting lectures with mental health check ins and making it well known she is always there to talk. Assignments were fair. She gave a very good outline for the term paper. Final was open book, take home. She doesn't record lectures though.

Dr.Fredericks was a great professor. The class consisted of weekly tutorials, a midterm(straight forwards), an 8-page paper, and a take-home final, where you picked two questions and answered them with a minimum 750 word response (and it was open for a week to complete). I thought this class would be boring but I really enjoyed it.
